result.execSummary:
The defendant James Eric Simon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as ordered for probation EXCEPT condition time at the House of Correction.
Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device for a period of  3 years to commence after the period of revocation has been served.
Court ordered Alcohol Assessment; form filed.

miscConds.notes: Pay a FINE of $600  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges (including DNA surcharge).   Any remaining cash bail posted on this case, to be applied to fine amount imposed.  The balance to be paid during the term of probation.  Court orders penalty for Nonpayment of fines is conversion into a civil judgment.
Pay Restitution in the amount of $1,601.08 to Jennifer L.  Cash bail posted on this case to be applied to restitution owed.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with any programs or treatment recommended by the agent.
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

AODA assessment and comply with any treatment.
Absolute Sobriety. Random screens.

timeConds.notes: Release privileges for employment and treatment.  Good time credit may be earned.  Sentence to commence FORTHWITH. Court finds the defendant IS eligible for the Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Eric Simon

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Letter response to letter from defendant requesting explanation of sentence credit for condition time.
Letter from defendant requesting explanation of sentence credit for condition time.
Restitution Refund
Per Request and Order submitted to Court on 11/19/2015; Order was signed on 11/20/2015,

A review of the sentencing hearing transcript indicates an error in the sentencing entry of 10-28-2015.

The Sentencing Entry to be  AMENDED as follows:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Serve 10  MONTHS in the House of Correction, with Zero days credit, release privileges for employment and treatment.  Good time credit may be earned.  Sentence to commence FORTHWITH.  Court finds the defendant IS eligible for the Day Reporting Center.

All other terms and conditions of the sentencing entry to remain as previously entered into the court record.
Request to Correct Judgment of Conviction submitted to the court for Court's approval.
Clerk:  jms
records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: 11/17/15 restitution notice/affidavit mailed to victim.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel, and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  5 years, with 5 days credit; -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  2 and 1/2  years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  2 and 1/2 years 

Court STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 (three) years:

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Serve 10  MONTHS in the House of Correction, with 5 days credit, release privileges for employment and treatment.  Good time credit may be earned.  Sentence to commence FORTHWITH.  Court finds the defendant IS eligible for the Day Reporting Center.
-  no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $1,601.08
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $1,601.08 to Jennifer L.  Cash bail posted on this case to be applied to restitution owed.
-  Pay a FINE of $600  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges (including DNA surcharge).   Any remaining cash bail posted on this case, to be applied to fine amount imposed.  The balance to be paid during the term of probation.  Court orders penalty for Nonpayment of fines is conversion into a civil judgment.
-  cooperate with any programs or treatment recommended by the agent
-  AODA assessment and comply with any treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random screens
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Perform 50 hours of community service
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment 

Court ordered Alcohol Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for  3 years.  
Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device for a period of  3 years to commence after the period of revocation has been served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Same conditions as ordered for probation EXCEPT condition time at the House of Correction

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant James Eric Simon in court with Attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.
Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program status report dated 10/28/15 received and filed.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Defendant's appearance is excused by the court.  David Robles appeared for Franco Mineo the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State requested an adjournment of the plea and sentencing granted by the court.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Report received and filed.

Defendant James Eric Simon in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 19.
Case in court for plea and sentencing, however Branch 22 does not have time to hear the matter and adjourns the plea and sentencing back to Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.
Victim impact statement received and filed.

WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program status report dated 9/4/15 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant James Eric Simon in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court to give defendant new date.  Plea and sentence moved from 08/07/2015 at 8:30am to 09/04/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 19.

At the request of the defense attorney, and without objection from the state or court, plea and sentencing date is moved from 08/07/2015 to 09/04/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 19.  Due to defendant's out of custody status, status conference is set on 07/02/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22 to give the defendant notice of the new court date.

Defendant James Eric Simon in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant James Eric Simon in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas Potter for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling Conference scheduled on May 4, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 22.

Defendant James Eric Simon in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 4/10/15.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/06/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Eric Simon in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant James Eric Simon in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
